item.title: 澳大利亚央行维持利率稳定，对通货膨胀持谨慎态度
item.description: 澳大利亚央行周二一如预期将现金利率维持在3.60%的稳定水平，并表示鉴于核心通胀率上升、消费需求坚挺以及房地产市场复苏，央行对进一步放宽政策持谨慎态度。【原文：Australia's central bank on Tuesday left its cash rate steady as expected at 3.60%, saying it was cautious about easing further given higher core inflation, firmer consumer demand and a revival in the housing market.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行认为核心通胀率在 2026 年年中后仍将高于目标值
item.description: 路透社悉尼11月4日电）澳大利亚央行目前认为，随着消费需求和房价的增长速度超过预期，核心通胀率将在2026年中期之前一直顽固地保持在目标区间之上，这似乎限制了进一步降息的空间。【原文：SYDNEY, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Australia's central bank now sees core inflation staying stubbornly above its target band out to the middle of 2026 as consumer demand and house prices pick up faster than expected, seemingly limiting room for further cuts in interest rates.】

item.title: 科技股反弹推动东京、台北股市创新高；美元上涨
item.description: 科技股的上涨使日本日经指数（Nikkei）和台湾台北国际股票交易所（TAIEX）周二创下历史新高，但该地区其他市场在近期创纪录的涨势后纷纷走低。【原文：A rise in tech shares lifted Japan's Nikkei and Taiwan's TAIEX to all-time highs on Tuesday, though other markets in the region were lower following their own recent record rallies.】

item.title: 洛克希德公司称正努力加快推迟向台湾交付的 F-16 战斗机
item.description: 洛克希德-马丁公司周二表示，该公司正在努力加快推迟向台湾交付新的F-16V战斗机，此前台湾国防部称该计划因供应链问题而推迟。【原文：Lockheed Martin said on Tuesday it was working to accelerate delayed deliveries to Taiwan of new F-16Vs, after the island's defence ministry said the programme had been pushed back due to supply chain issues.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，中国 WeRide 在香港上市的目标价约为 3.08 亿美元
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，中国自动驾驶公司WeRide计划以每股27.10港元的价格出售其香港股票，旨在通过上市融资23.9亿港元（约合3.077亿美元）。【原文：Chinese autonomous driving firm WeRide plans to price its Hong Kong share sale at HK$27.10 per share, aiming to raise HK$2.39 billion ($307.7 million) from the listing, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 星巴克将以 40 亿美元向博裕资本出售中国业务控制权
item.description: 星巴克周一表示，将向投资公司博裕资本出售其中国业务的控制权，交易价值为 40 亿美元，这是近年来全球消费企业剥离中国业务价值最高的交易之一。【原文：Starbucks said on Monday it would sell control of its China operations to investment firm Boyu Capital in a deal valued at $4 billion, in one of the most valuable divestments of a China unit by a global consumer company in recent years.】

item.title: 市场消化欧佩克+产量计划，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 石油价格周二早盘变化不大，因为市场考虑到欧佩克+决定在第一季度暂停增产，尽管市场对供应过剩的担忧依然存在。【原文：Oil prices were little changed early on Tuesday as markets weighed OPEC+'s decision to pause output hikes in the first quarter even as concerns over a looming supply glut persisted.】

item.title: 标准普尔500指数和纳斯达克指数因亚马逊与开放人工智能公司达成交易而收高；美联储的前进之路变得扑朔迷离
item.description: 尽管美联储的近期货币政策因美国官方经济数据的稀缺而变得越来越迷雾重重，但周一 S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数收盘上涨，与人工智能相关的交易推动了大部分涨幅。【原文：The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq closed higher on Monday, with artificial intelligence-related deals driving much of the gains even as the Federal Reserve's near-term monetary policy grew increasingly foggy due to scarcity of official U.S. economic data.】

item.title: 交易员减少近期降息押注，美元创 3 个月新高
item.description: 美元周二持稳，徘徊在三个月高点附近，原因是美联储意见分歧促使交易员减少降息押注，而投资者则在等待澳大利亚政策会议的召开，澳大利亚央行可能会按兵不动。【原文：The dollar was steady on Tuesday, hovering near a three-month high as a divided Federal Reserve spurred traders to rein in interest rate cut wagers while investors awaited an Australian policy meeting where the central bank is likely to stand pat.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：中国为科技巨头提供廉价电力，以促进国产人工智能芯片的发展
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周一援引熟知内情的人士的话报道称，中国已增加补贴，使国内一些最大的数据中心的能源费用最多可减少一半。【原文：China has increased subsidies that cut energy bills by up to half for some of the country's largest data centres, the Financial Times reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国监管机构驳回殖民地管道公司改变东北部汽油输送方式的计划
item.description: 美国联邦能源管理委员会（FERC）周一否决了殖民地管道公司（Colonial Pipeline）改变从墨西哥湾沿岸向东北部消费者输送汽油的方式的提议，指出该公司未能证明该提议是公正合理的。【原文：The U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) on Monday rejected a Colonial Pipeline proposal to change the way it delivers gasoline from the Gulf Coast to consumers in the Northeast, noting the company failed to show the proposal was just and reasonable.】

item.title: 美国要求法院驳回达美航空公司和墨西哥航空公司推迟结束合资企业的请求
item.description: 特朗普政府周一要求美国上诉法院驳回达美航空公司和墨西哥航空公司的诉讼请求，以阻止一项迫使它们解除合资企业的命令，该合资企业允许这两家航空公司协调美国-墨西哥航班的调度、定价和运力。【原文：The Trump administration on Monday asked a U.S. appeals court to reject a bid by Delta Air Lines and Aeromexico to halt an order forcing them to unwind a joint venture that lets the carriers coordinate scheduling, pricing and capacity for U.S.–Mexico flights.】

item.title: 美国旅游组织警告国会，政府关门将导致感恩节混乱
item.description: 周一，一个旅游协会在一封信中敦促美国国会在感恩节旅游高峰到来之前重新开放联邦政府，因为美国政府关门已经持续到了第 34 天。【原文：A travel association has urged the U.S. Congress in a letter on Monday to reopen the federal government ahead of the Thanksgiving travel rush, as the shutdown stretches into its 34th day.】

item.title: Patria 支持的 Omnia 公司加入价值 90 亿美元的巴西 TikTok 数据中心项目
item.description: 巴西投资公司 Patria 旗下的数据中心公司 Omnia 周一表示，它已加入在巴西开发价值 500 亿雷亚尔（约合 92.5 亿美元）数据中心的项目，预计 TikTok 将成为该项目唯一的客户。【原文：Omnia, a data center company owned by Brazilian investment firm Patria , said on Monday it has joined the project to develop a 50 billion real ($9.25 billion) data center in Brazil that is expected to have TikTok as its sole client.】

item.title: 连锁餐厅 Denny's 将以 6.2 亿美元的价格被私有化
item.description: 连锁餐厅 Denny's 周一宣布，它将被 TGI Fridays 所有者 TriArtisan Capital Advisors 组成的集团收购，交易金额为 6.2 亿美元，其中包括债务。【原文：Restaurant chain Denny's announced on Monday it would be acquired by a group comprising TGI Fridays-owner TriArtisan Capital Advisors in a $620 million deal, including debt.】

item.title: 美国检察官称网络安全专业人员负责网络犯罪活动
item.description: 检察官说，三名美国网络安全专业人员秘密实施了一项勒索软件行动，目的是震慑全美各地的公司。【原文：Prosecutors said three American cybersecurity professionals secretly ran a ransomware operation aimed at shaking down companies across the United States.】

item.title: 纽约要求驳回埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司就仇恨言论法提起的诉讼
item.description: 纽约州周一要求法官驳回埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司提起的诉讼，该诉讼旨在废除一项要求社交媒体公司披露如何监控仇恨言论、极端主义、骚扰、外国政治干预和虚假信息的州法律。【原文：New York asked a judge on Monday to dismiss a lawsuit by Elon Musk's X to void a state law requiring social media companies to disclose how they monitor hate speech, extremism, harassment, foreign political interference and disinformation.】

item.title: 三星 SDI 表示正在讨论为特斯拉提供 ESS 电池
item.description: 韩国三星 SDI 正在讨论向特斯拉供应 ESS（储能系统）电池的事宜，据说订单价值约为 3 万亿韩元（21.1 亿美元）或更多。【原文：South Korea's Samsung SDI is discussing supplying ESS (Energy Storage System) batteries to Tesla in an order reported to be worth around 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion) or more.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定可就儿童佳洁士包装起诉宝洁公司
item.description: 宝洁公司必须面对一起诉讼，指控其儿童佳洁士牙膏的包装暗示儿童可以使用超过安全剂量的牙膏。【原文：Procter & Gamble must face a lawsuit alleging that its packaging for Kid's Crest suggests that children can use more of the toothpaste than is safe.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，美国大中型企业的贷款需求有所改善
item.description: 美联储周一的一项调查显示，第三季度美国大中型企业的商业贷款需求创下约三年来的最大增幅，而小型企业的需求则与上一季度基本持平。【原文：Business loan demand from large and mid-sized U.S. firms strengthened by the most in about three years in the third quarter while demand from small firms was essentially unchanged from the prior quarter, a Federal Reserve survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: SBA Communications 第三季度业绩超出预期，上调 2025 年收入预期
item.description: 受移动网络运营商对场地租赁服务稳定需求的帮助，SBA Communications 第三季度业绩超出预期，并于周一上调了全年营收预期。【原文：SBA Communications beat third-quarter estimates and raised its annual revenue forecast on Monday, helped by steady demand for its site leasing services from mobile network operators.】

item.title: 谁在出售？星巴克和其他美国公司缩减中国市场份额
item.description: 在首席执行官布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）上任并启动重组约一年后，星巴克周一宣布将其中国业务的大部分股份出售给博裕资本，交易价值为 40 亿美元。【原文：Starbucks announced on Monday it was selling a majority stake in its China business to Boyu Capital in a deal valued at $4 billion, about a year after CEO Brian Niccol took the helm and launched a restructuring.】

item.title: Grab Holdings 季度收入超出预期
item.description: Grab Holdings周一公布的第三季度营收超出分析师预期，主要得益于其平台扩张吸引了更多用户，消费者在打车和送餐服务上的支出强劲。【原文：Grab Holdings beat analysts' expectations for third-quarter revenue on Monday, helped by robust consumer spending on ride-hailing and food-delivery services as its platform expansion draws in more users.】

item.title: 重塑星巴克布莱恩-尼科尔执掌星巴克第一年的重大举措
item.description: 布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）于 2024 年 8 月接任星巴克首席执行官一职，当时这家咖啡连锁店正努力应对美国市场对其价格昂贵的拿铁咖啡需求疲软的问题，并考虑出售其中国分部的股份。【原文：Brian Niccol took over as Starbucks' CEO in August 2024, as the coffee chain struggled with weak demand for its pricey lattes in the U.S. and contemplated selling a stake in its China division.】

item.title: 欧盟贸易负责人认为耐克斯佩里亚谈判取得进展
item.description: 欧洲贸易委员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周一表示，涉及荷兰和中国的荷兰芯片制造商Nexperia的谈判正在取得进展。【原文：European Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Monday that talks over the Dutch chipmaker Nexperia, which involve the Netherlands and China, were advancing.】

item.title: Kenvue的法律风险笼罩着金佰利公司的收购计划
item.description: 金佰利公司（Kimberly-Clark）周一表示，它计划收购创可贴生产商肯维公司（Kenvue），而后者正面临着涉及其止痛药泰诺（Tylenol）和含滑石粉的婴儿爽身粉的数千起诉讼。【原文：Kimberly-Clark said on Monday it plans to acquire Band-Aid maker Kenvue , even as the latter company faces thousands of lawsuits involving its painkiller Tylenol and talc-based baby powder, raising questions about the scope of the liabilities Kimberly-Clark might inherit.】

item.title: 交易日：经济现实打击了人工智能和交易的乐观情绪
item.description: 华尔街周一涨跌不一，企业交易活动活跃，另一项与人工智能相关的大型合作被美国经济增长和利率前景不明所抵消，而美元则升至三个月来的新高。【原文：Wall Street was mixed on Monday, with bumper corporate dealmaking activity and another mega AI-related tie-up offset by murky signals around the path for U.S. growth and interest rates, while the dollar crept up to a fresh three-month high.】

item.title: 星巴克将以 40 亿美元向博裕资本出售中国业务控制权
item.description: 星巴克周一表示，已同意将其中国业务的控制权出售给投资公司博裕资本，交易价值为 40 亿美元。【原文：Starbucks said on Monday it has agreed to sell control of its China operations to investment firm Boyu Capital in a deal valued at $4 billion.】

item.title: 宾夕法尼亚大学称已就数据泄露事件致电联邦调查局
item.description: 宾夕法尼亚大学称，在向校友分发了攻击性电子邮件后，该校已请联邦调查局介入调查。【原文：The University of Pennsylvania says it has called in the Federal Bureau of Investigation after offensive emails were distributed to alumni.】

item.title: 西蒙地产集团上调年度房地产 FFO 预期，原因是租赁需求恢复性增长
item.description: 商业地产投资信托公司西蒙地产集团（Simon Property Group）周一上调了全年房地产运营资金的预期，原因是其购物中心的租赁需求保持强劲。【原文：Commercial real estate investment trust Simon Property Group raised full-year forecast for real estate funds from operations on Monday, driven by resilient leasing demand across its shopping centers.】
